### Bio

Dr. Chad Weldy is a cardiologist and physician-scientist in the Division of
Cardiovascular Medicine at Stanford University. His research integrates
human genetics, RNA biology, and vascular biology to uncover causal
mechanisms of cardiovascular disease.

His work has led to discoveries identifying **ADAR1-mediated RNA editing**
and innate immune sensing as causal pathways in coronary artery disease,
as well as defining the **epigenomic landscape of human vascular cells**
across developmental origins and disease states.
